Going into the series, I believed that it was going to be something tear jerking like AnoHana or something upon those lines but instead it took me by surprise and was quite lighthearted and managed to squeeze in some humor within the first half of the series while having little bits of the darker side of the story slither in. 
Story - 8 - For me the story really started to shape in the latter half of the series and the real meat of the story became rushed in my eyes due to that which kind of limited the depth into which the story couldproceed. I felt as though there was a little bit of filler, or at least I didn't feel as though the episode in question had any real bearing upon the totality of the story. My dilemma with the story was that it started slow and ended fast so the pace was quite off but I think the melding of those moments of lightheartedness with those of gloom offset my complaint about the pace.


Art - 6 - Overall the art wasn't something special to me but I think more than the art, there were certain moments which were brilliantly drawn, mainly the flashbacks and being a not very detail oriented person, I didn't notice anything that was out of the ordinary with the style of art.


Sound - 6 -  I think the voice acting was decent although the change in puberty for one of the characters was a little bit exaggerated. The OP and ED were alright although I prefer the OP much more than the ED. I absolutely hated Aoi's voice .


Character - 7 - I definitely enjoyed the characters and honestly, there isn't much I found that was disagreeable with me in the characters. I think they did a pretty good job with developing the back stories of the characters except for like one. 


Overall - 7 - It was an alright anime overall nothing too special, and I think that's only because I saw AnoHana before I saw this. I think the least enjoyable part of the story was the ending or just how the ending was put forth. It didn't really match the rest of the story, well at least the presentation didn't.

Contains mild spoiler.
Animes based on visual novels have the potential to be extremely bad, and cliched. Myselfl; Yourself fortunately dodged a few bullets. For starters, it didn’t go into the harem genre (where all girls are into the same ordinary guy for no understandable reason). It is not an overly original anime, but it has its very own interesting plot. Are the characters and situations cliched? Sure. Is the story that bad? No. It is an anime about romance, where one relationship blossoms as the protagonists come to terms with traumatic life events.
This anime deserves credit for being quite realistic despite its dramatic plot points.Out of the four lead females, only one is actually in love with Sana. Others are good friends of his. Two have a different love interest. I found this very refreshing. Although this anime focusses on the relationship between Sana and Nanaka, it is really about their group of friends, and how friends need to be there for each other. I was touched by the strong feelings of friendship uniting Sana and his friends just as much as I was touched by his romance with Nanaka.\n\n
My only complain would be that the pacing was not the best, but it wasn’t the worst either. The first episodes develop slowly, while the last few episodes unload all the dramatic potential of the series. I would say it is definitely worth watching until the end, otherwise you don’t get a story out of this anime. Plus, the art is nice, so it shouldn’t be too painful to watch 13 episodes. All in all, it is a pleasant anime that you can watch with confidence if you want a sweet romance with heart wrenching drama and lovable characters. It looks a little bit like School Days, but unlike School Days, this one takes a perfectly fine watchable-material route. The only danger is that it might bore some people :)

"...that I'd be able to reach the you of the past..."
Story (7): If you're looking for drama, mystey, drama and romance (no, there's no typo, I repeated drama twice), you'll find it here. They manage to keep the mstery during the entire developemen of the anime, but the pace is a little disturbing; they work nicely with time changes, but seem to have a hard time working with the way things happen in the present time.
Art (8): I've no complaints with the art, don't understand why blood is black, but that's all heh.
Sound (8): The music is very well fitting, specilly the opening. Overall thesound was ok, but Aoi's voice turned a bit annoying if she talked too much.\n\n
Character (6): The characters by themselves are very nice, yet, the way they react at certain times of the anime seem a bit unrealistic. Also, there's a strange excess of development in supporting characters that could have been used to develop more of the main characters.\n\n
Enjoyment (6): Ok, the story was ok and the suspense was nicely kept, but I certainly would have enjoyed more character development and less unnecesary ecchi hints, those are too over rated in this kind of animes...\n\n
Overall (7): The story improves as it develops and starts leaving behind the fillers. Again, if you enjoy drama and the mystery behind people's actions, you'll probably enjoy Myself, Yourself.

Let me start off with Aoi's voice is like a million nails scratching down the chalkboard of life (yeah it's that annoying, may I recommend muting her voice when she appears). Now then, the story is a little cliche, but *SLIGHT SPOILER ALERT* the whole suicidal thing was very original and made the ending a little more bearable and explained that stupid watch that Sana wears. Other than those interesting details, the story maintains those little sub stories that we're all too familiar with to add dramatic affect.
Overall I give this 8/10, its not a groundbreaking anime unless this is the first drama you've everwatched.

Myself ; Yourself does look like a Harem Anime OR a corny slice of life anime on the cover, but if we know ONE thing, it's never judge an ANIME by it's cover!
Animes can surprise when you least expect it and Myself'; Yourself doesn't offer any less. 
The anime starts with the main character, Sana Hidaka's farewell party who has to move out of the town he has grown in. His close friends, all cheerful and innocent are present.
5 years later, Sana comes back to town only to find his closest friend, Nanaka Yatsushiro completely changed. While, others have severe problems too.
The story follows theLife of Sana who tries to get along with his friends, slowly discovering all their miseries. 


High School, Romance and Slice of Life may seem to be all the anime contains, but after a few couple of episodes, the story reveals a darker and intense side to it, about the character's past and present.


Myself ; Yourself deserves a watch if you consider yourself an anime fan, but its not the best anime out there. 

The story could have been faster at some places, and could have had more of intense.


M ; Y revolves more around character relationships more than romance, the main feature which makes it better (than) and distinct to School days.


Overall: 8/10

Everyone has said what is basically needed to be said.  It looks like a typical harem, but it's different.  It's like a bad soap opera met an anime.  
Like a bad teen romance soap.
To start, the characters are terrible.  The constant change of personality, obvious bending of character traits to fit the story; the list goes on.  This has a drastic impact on the story, as well.  The story, though, is almost impossible to follow half of the time.  Every episode brings a different story to it, only carrying certain things through to the next episodes.  Thepassing of time is completely unknown aside from day and night, so this could occur in days or months; I don't know.  The art and sound was decent enough.  Not 5 centimeters per second good, but passable.  It kept me watching through all the episodes, but only because it managed to somewhat keep my attention.  But, once I start an anime, I usually try to finish it anyway.\n\n
Others may feel different than I do, but maybe I'm too used to watching top-tier anime.

To start off with, I entered this series because of a promised "Childhood Friend Romance". I got WAY more than anticipated. WAY more.
Story 6/10: It starts out cliche and boring. Outright generic. But then it picks up pace around Episode 5 and shows it's "true" colours. Not to say that it wasn't hinted or foreshadowed in the first 4 episodes, but it starts to actually pick up the pace into something reasonable. For comparison the first 4 episodes are paced like an extremely long-running series. They get virtually nowhere unless you look at the bigger picture. The rest is paced as a normal 12-ish episodeanime. Which means there is 4 or so wasted episodes that could have been properly used.


Art 6/10: Black Blood. Otherwise self-explanatory.


Sound 6/10: The sound was fair, but fell into some major annoyances at some (mostly) remote instances. Most of the problems with sound stem from Aoi's insufferable voice.


Character 8/10: A diverse cast that generally gets a good amount of screen time each. Sometimes some useless side-characters or people of no importance got screen time, but so be it. Characters:


Sana - Indecisive and foolish main character, gets himself together when he starts to understand whats going on rather than agreeing to everything.


Nanaka - Broken goods. Hair-trigger PTSD.


Aoi - Earsplitting voice that plays no major role despite being a main character?


Shusuke - Sana's best friend. Has a twin sister and an abusive, conceited father who marries a cheating gold-digger. Protective of his twin sister for "reasons" and frequently takes beatings from his father meant for her.


Shuri - Shusuke's twin sister. Tomboy. Needlessly spiteful towards her father and moreso the gold-digger he married. As in, unjustifiably spiteful. Her reasoning is completely biased towards herself and childish "You're not my mom!" based arguments.


Hinako - Unimportant side-character that disappears as fast as she came. Is a 10/11 year old who has a crush on Shusuke. 10 years later she seems to be dating a 15 year old highschool student at the age of 20, simply because he resembles her first love. Statutory rape anyone? Mind you she looks like a highschool student by reasoning of being a washboard-Loli.


Enjoyment 7/10: This is where things are debatable between different viewers. On some notes the stories for each characters are relatively well done. On other notes, some viewers can be turned off by quite a few events that are unpleasant to watch or implying "taboo".


Overall 7/10: Could have had a much better ending. Most of it was only implied. Most of what turns people off about the ending are 3 things that imply whats going on, but don't 100% confirm it. The viewers basically know with what's given, but for whatever reason they didn't outright confirm anything by being vague or purposely omitting information that by all means should be there.
This anime was good in the beginning and then it started getting a little angst and a depressing towards the end....it was getting dark

Pretty good dramatic story, with some flaws...
This series works through a fairly dramatic story line. It stays focused on the main characters, so you get to understand some of the dynamics of each person and between the characters. There is somewhat of a "train wreck" ending, but not completely. Some loose ends were left perhaps in the event of a second season, but that seems unlikely at this point.
The problem with series, and the main reason why I only gave it 4 stars, is that many of the main dramatic events in were so unbelievable that the story began to lose its credulity. I thinkits OK to have one or two shockers in a story line, but this story has them by the barrel-ful and at some point it just becomes exhausting. Still, it was an enjoyable, bittersweet story, but it will probably leave you unsatisfied at the end.

Fifteen year old Sana returns to the town where he grew up, after spending five years away and is reunited with his childhood friends. While he finds that dorky Aoi and twins Syusuke and Syuri are much the same, the once sweet and shy Nanaka has become cold and withdrawn. He also meets a cute fellow student named Asami, and a brattish elementary school student called Hinako. All of these characters experience a certain amount of character development, with the exception of cheerful Aoi who simply remains a fun comic element throughout. The dark story lines that develop in the second half add some depthto the romantic comedy elements and don’t really jar. There’s plenty of emotion and drama, although it may be too much for some (not me, I like melodrama!) and when the plot twists aren’t predictable, they do tend a little towards the ridiculous. I was a little disappointed with the ending — while I quite liked the reveal of a certain mystery, the episode was rushed and the epilogue didn’t really seem to add anything.


Visually it has a typical anime style (complete with big eyes and unnatural hair colours and styles) but it expresses itself well, and at times the colouring is very pretty. The music is pretty good, with a catchy OP and some suitably dramatic incidental music.


If you like fanservice-filled romantic comedies and want to see something with a little more depth and seriousness, this is definitely worth a try. It doesn’t succeed in all areas, but it does have something unique about it.

I was in WOW mode (not world of warcraft lol ), the characters were good and the background infomation was good too. The music for the OP was average but the ED theme was AMAZING its so catchy and though the anime the music used for tension was great too.
the story was quite good but with a 12episode series it went too quick and the ending was mega-rushed, although i can't give any spoilers the ending is terrible not because of an incedent but due to the way it was rushed, during the anime i was thinking this could be an "Underdog" but it just got worse with time.

I had to put a pause on this anime around episode 4 so please keep that in mind if I for got anything. I overall did enjoy Myself;Yourself, it was a nice change of pace, and story altogether compared to all the other anime I have watched that usually have the same stereotypical stories, and endings. 
and despite what I have said over 10 times in this review the anime is not as dark as I say it is, however it is darker than most anime I am used to so for me it is fairly dark, although I still really enjoyed it.
Story
The story initself is very dark for the most part in my opinion, now that being said there are the happy times in play. When Sana moves back he reunited with his old friends, and from that point everything is very happy, until an incident happens that causes a little drama and from this point I feel it was a roller coaster ride, with something new to add into play each and every episode. 


Art

This may just be me, and I didn't look at dates these anime were made so excuse me about that but I feel whenever I am watching a dark anime there is normally this kind of art, I have no idea why I am using this as an example, but I find this art makes everything seem more real and set on a more personal level.  This may not make sense, however I hope most will understand what I mean. I feel this art just makes everything stick out more, and so we are not always focusing on the characters.


Sound

I really enjoyed the opening, not as much as others, but it was okay. I even listened to it more than once while watching the series, the violin music was also very nice, I especially enjoyed the song that she played for sana. The background sound normally fit into what it was being played for whether it be a dark and depressing moment or a happy and cheerful one, although I didn't really pay much attention, as I don't normally. 


Character

Now the character development was amazing, all characters had a backstory, and I guess you coud say problem, although some more dark than others. I do wish some of the back stories weren't as rushed, and we had a little more development I still find it was a decent character development for a 12 episode anime, had it been 24 episodes we could have seen a little more, and maybe had a little cleaner ending. (not to say it wasn't good)


Enjoyment 

Now as I stated at the top I did have a pause on the anime for a short time, because of me not really enjoying it. When I sarted again and passed episode 5 I believe it was I started enjoying it much more, because the plot was getting a little thinker in a sense, I really did enjoy this anime. I enjoyed the happy times and the sad times.  Although there are some weird things that happened that I was very confused about, they pushed the story. Now back on topic I overall enjoyed the anime very much. 8/10 for being a little different and original. 


Overall

I overall enjoyed it as stated, I would recommend anyone to give this anime a try, unless you can't stand sad or depressing anime. I believe this is my first review unless I did one that I forgot about, but that being said please excuse the crappiness of it.

Well, at first I thought it was a run of the mill romance anime which was what I was looking for, but instead, everything came rushing at me and i couldn't help but to finish it. It's not a typical romance anime, there are a lot of twists that you won't expect. This is probably one of the better romance/drama's that I've watched.
